Catalano.Imaging.Tools

Class ZernikeMoments

  • java.lang.Object
    • Catalano.Imaging.Tools.ZernikeMoments

  • public final class ZernikeMoments
extends java.lang.Object
    Compute Zernike moments. Zernike polynomials are widely used as basis functions of image moments. Since Zernike polynomials are orthogonal to each other, Zernike moments can represent properties of an image with no redundancy or overlap of information between the moments. Although Zernike moments are significantly dependent on the scaling and the translation of the object in an ROI, their magnitudes are independent of the rotation angle of the object. Thus, they can be utilized to extract features from images that describe the shape characteristics of an object. For instance, Zernike moments are utilized as shape descriptors to classify benign and malignant breast masses.
